item.title: Connect to headless Raspberry with SSH and Wireshark
item.description: In many situations one would like to connect to their Raspberry Pi without the needing a keyboard, mouse and a screen. Most people don’t have them just lying around. Then the only option is to connect your laptop and Raspberry with an Ethernet cable, either directly or via a router, and then use SSH to remotely login into the Raspberry. This latter option is called “headless” connection, because of the lack of a GUI.

item.title: Motivation
item.description: The main motivation for this blog is to have a reference to my thoughts and opinions throughout time, as I noticed it’s very hard for me to remember all the things that I believed 5-10 years ago. I think it’s a necessity to ask other people’s opinion about your ideas, and one of them should be you, you from X years ago. You are a different person now, after so long, but still share a lot in common with past-you.
